page.title: 12British Rail
page.content: British Rail run a single track railway from Llandudno to Blaenau Ffestiniog north to south through the Conwy valley. There is a station at Llanrwst, and it is here that we find the loop in the line which allows up and down trains to pass. Llanrwst is an unmanned station and fares are paid to the guard on the train. The trains must halt at a signal box about 3OOyds north of the station for the exchange of tokens, which are leather bound rings with small purses attached. The driver may not proceed without this exchange which prevents two trains using the same length of track at the same time. The service is very limited in winter, 6 trains in each direction daily and no Sunday service. In summer the service is augmented to 9 trains and special Sunday excursions are run.
